I'm sorry i'm using a new thread which could be used to ask a good question or make a good suggestion but i didn't find any other place to post this... So basically it's just a thank you post... i've just saw the scott manley video on the .25 update and i just wanted to share with everyone here that's there's no game that get me THIS excited and THIS happy... i mean this is a great game, unbelievable great or however is that said, i believe u'll get what i mean...

Just thank you to all the developers of this game, you are the greatest of all... this game... it's just so amazing in every fu**ing aspect... so awesome, full of things to do, so "vast", so intense... just thank you guys... you've done something incredible here, i happen to know thru an interview to harvester i read, how did this idea come up, amazing... i'm just so excited about this game... it's a game i play every now and then since i found it thru a youtube video, and it's one of the only games i just don't get bored to play... and it makes me so happy to see every new update, the new features, everything... as a matter of fact i was watching the new update video i mentioned and i had to hug my gf, it makes me so happy to see the development, even though i don't help it in any way, just if you include it as a development aid, by buying the game...

I'm just repeating myself, haha, it gets me like this... so i'll get to the point:

Thank you devs for making this great game and keep working on it, there's still a lot to do i imagine, but i know you are able to deliver it with quality and are concerned on every possible aspect of the development, you care about the players and about developing this awesome game... Thank you.- Gracias, de verdad.-

PS: sorry if my english is confusing or hard to follow, it's not my native language, i just wanted to "release" all the good feelings this game causes on me, and i thought that it was time to thank the devs for their great work...

I'm sure most of us feel like this about KSP. I mean, it helped me cope with depression almost two years ago, and now it has steered my life into space exploration. I'm starting Mechanical Engineering in 2016 and Aerospace Engineering next.

Definitely worth the ~20 bucks.
